memberdef.name: packMsg

briefdescription.para: Pack a message, used by the system.

detaileddescription.para: Packs bytes directly after a message into a single contiguous buffer to send. The message better have sufficient space allocated after the message to pack these bytes. This is often used when the memory pool slot selected comes with some extra space instead of sending two separate buffers.

parameterdescription.para: message to pack
size of message
pointer to pack
bytes at pointer to pack

briefdescription.para: Send raw bytes to a node.

parameterdescription.para: the pointer and bytes to send
the destination node
the MPI tag put on the send (if vt::no_tag, increments tag)

simplesect.para: a tuple with the event ID and tag used

the tag this handler will accept (vt::no_tag means any)

the tag this handler will accept (vt::no_tag means any)

briefdescription.para: Get the current handler (valid only while running a handler)
Get the from node for the current running handler (valid only while running a handler)

detaileddescription.para: For the current handler that is executing, get the node that sent the message that caused this handler to run. Note, for collection handlers this will not be the logical node that sent the message. It will be the node that last forwarded the message during location discovery.

simplesect.para: the node that sent the message that triggered the current handler

briefdescription.para: Get the current epoch on the handler running.

simplesect.para: the epoch on the message that triggered the current handler

briefdescription.para: Get the priority on the handler running.

simplesect.para: the priority on the message that triggered the current handler

briefdescription.para: Get the priority level on the handler running.

simplesect.para: the priority level of the message that triggered the current handler

the sender of the message
the size of the message
whether to insert the message if handler does not exist

briefdescription.para: Set the global epoch (pushEpoch is more desirable)

detaileddescription.para: setGlobalEpoch() is a shortcut for both pushing and popping epochs on the stack depending on the value of the `epoch' passed as an argument.

parameterdescription.para: the epoch to set

briefdescription.para: Get the current global epoch.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the top epoch on the stack iff epoch_stack.size() > 0, else it returns vt::no_epoch

briefdescription.para: Push an epoch on the stack.

detaileddescription.para: Pushes any epoch onto the local stack iff epoch != no_epoch; the epoch stack includes all locally pushed epochs and the current contexts pushed, transitively causally related active message handlers.

parameterdescription.para: the epoch to push

briefdescription.para: Pop an epoch off the stack.

detaileddescription.para: Shall remove the top entry from epoch_size_, iff the size is non-zero and the `epoch' passed, if `epoch != no_epoch', is equal to the top of the `epoch_stack_.top()'; else, it shall remove any entry from the top of the stack.

parameterdescription.para: the epoch that is expected to exist on the stack

simplesect.para: the epoch popped off the stack

briefdescription.para: Returns the top of the epoch stack.

simplesect.para: the epoch on the top of the stack

briefdescription.para: Get the epoch for a message based on the current context so an subsequent operation on it can be safely delayed.

parameterdescription.para: the message to set the epoch on

simplesect.para: the epoch on the message or from context

briefdescription.para: Get the epoch for a message based on the current context so an subsequent operation on it can be safely delayed.

parameterdescription.para: the message (shared ptr) to set the epoch on

simplesect.para: the epoch on the message or from context

briefdescription.para: Set the epoch on a message.

detaileddescription.para: The method finds the current epoch based on whether its already set on the message (which in that case it uses the one on the message already) or obtains the current epoch from the epoch stack based on the handler that is running

parameterdescription.para: the message to get/set the epoch on

briefdescription.para: Set the epoch on th message.

parameterdescription.para: the message to get/set the epoch on

briefdescription.para: Register a listener on the active messengersee Listener.

parameterdescription.para: a std::unique_ptr<L> to a listener

briefdescription.para: Clear all listeners.

memberdef.argsstring: (MsgPtrT msg, HandlerType const handler, auto_registry::RegistryTypeEnum type, MsgSizeType msg_size, bool is_bcast)
memberdef.name: makeTraceCreationSend

briefdescription.para: Core component of VT used to send messages to handlers without a context.

detaileddescription.para: ActiveMessenger is a core VT component that provides the ability to send messages Message to registered handlers. It manages the incoming and outgoing messages using MPI to communicate MPI_Irecv and MPI_Isend

There are various ways to send messages:
Send Message Active Function (type-safe handler)
Basic Active Message Send with Pre-Registered Handler
Send Message BASIC Active Function
Send Message to Functor Variants
Send Data Message with data payload
